base.author: Marc Ahrens
base.contents:
NB The "10V actuation" specs gives some indication of power efficiency. At that voltage the current is about 2.7A (consistent with 3.8 Ohms), and the actuation time is 0.5s (consistent with graph of actuation time vs volts).
This means electric power is ElecPower=2.7*10=27W
The mechanical power is MechPower=Work/Time =Force*dist/0.5s =11N*9mm/0.5s =0.198W
Thus, power efficiency is MechPower/ElecPower = 0.198W / 27W = 0.73 %
Very low!
